tit.cmt: eshiは間違いでは？大辞林または広辞苑では"えいし"または"えじ"、ただし神宮衛士はwikiではじんぐえしともある。

sen.j: 衛士（えいし、えじ とも）
sen.e: 衛士 (eishi or eji)
衛士 (eishi or eji)
衛士 (eishi or eji)

sen.j: 律令制下で、主に諸国で軍団が敷かれていた時期に、宮中の護衛のために諸国の軍団から交代で上洛した兵士。
sen.e: Under the ritsuryo system eishi were soldiers who came up to Kyoto in rotation from gundan (army corps) in various districts as guards of the Imperial Court mainly when gundan were formed in various districts.

Under the ritsuryo system eishi were soldiers who came up to Kyoto in rotation from gundan (army corps) in various districts as guards of the Imperial Court mainly during the period when gundan were formed in various districts.
sen.cmt: during the period を追加しました。
sen.e: Under the ritsuryo system eishi were soldiers who came up to Kyoto in rotation from gundan (army corps) in various districts as guards of the Imperial Court mainly during the period when gundan were formed in various districts.

sen.j: 律令制下で、軍団に配置された兵士の称ないし諸国の軍団から交代で衛門府ないし衛士府に配属され、宮中の護衛を担った者の称。
sen.e: Under the ritsuryo system it was a name of a soldier posted in the gundan or a person from gundan in various districts who was posted in rotation in the emonfu (officials section) or the ejifu (guards section) and acted as guards in the Imperial Court.

Under the ritsuryo system it was a name of a soldier posted in the gundan or a person from gundan in various districts who was posted in rotation in the emonfu (officials section) or the ejifu (guards section) and acted as guards in the Imperial Court.

Under the ritsuryo system it was a name of a soldier posted in the gundan or a person from gundan in various districts who was posted in rotation in the emonfu (officials section) or the ejifu (guards section) and acted as guards in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: その他、転じて幕末に際して宮中を護衛した御陵衛士など義勇集団の名称。
sen.e: Others include a name of a group of men of loyalty and courage such as a group of goryo-eji that guarded the Imerial Court at the Bakumatsu (end of the samurai period).
It also became a name of a group of men of loyalty and courage such as a group of goryo-eji that guarded the Imperial Court at the Bakumatsu (end of the samurai period).
sen.cmt: Others include→It also became としました。Imperial スペル修正しました。
sen.e: It also became a name of a group of men of loyalty and courage such as a group of goryo-eji that guarded the Imperial Court at the Bakumatsu (end of the samurai period).

sen.j: 伊勢神宮および熱田神宮などで警護の任に当たった者。
sen.e: A person who guarded the Ise Jingu Shrine and the Atsuta Shrine => Refer to "Jingu-eji".
A person who guarded the Ise Jingu Shrine and the Atsuta Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処全角矢印を削除するため、分割しました。
sen.e: A person who guarded the Ise Jingu Shrine and the Atsuta Shrine.
Refer to 'Jingu-eji.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処" " を ' ' とし、ピリオドの位置を変えました。
sen.e: Refer to 'Jingu-eji.'

sen.j: 皇宮護衛官などの雅称。
sen.e: An elegant name of an Imperial Palace guard and so on.
An elegant name of an Imperial Palace guard and so on.
An elegant name of an Imperial Palace guard and so on.

sen.j: 主に和歌に歌われる際に使われる。
sen.e: The term is used mainly in composing waka (Japanese poems).
sen.cmt: 訳文入力箇所まちがいのため修正しました。
sen.e: The term is used mainly in composing waka (Japanese poems).

sen.j: 日本吟醸酒協会が運営する吟醸酒大学校で「吟の衛士講座」を修了した者にの称号が授与される称号「吟の衛士」。
sen.e: It is a title (Gin no eshi) given to a person who finished "Gin no Eji Course" in Ginjo Sake Daigaku-ko run by the Japan Ginjo Sake Association.
It is a title, 'Gin no eji,' given to a person who finished 'Gin no Eji Course' in Ginjo Sake Daigaku-ko run by the Japan Ginjo Sake Association.
sen.cmt: () を ' ' とし、eshi→eji としました。（同文内に Gin no Eji とあるため）" " を ' ' としました。
sen.e: It is a title, 'Gin no eji,' given to a person who finished 'Gin no Eji Course' in Ginjo Sake Daigaku-ko run by the Japan Ginjo Sake Association.
衛視 (eishi)
衛視 (eishi)
衛視 (eishi)

sen.j: 国会議事堂内で警察権を行使する国会職員。
sen.e: A Congressional staffer who exercises the police power in the Japanese Diet Building =>Refer to "Eishi".
A Diet official who exercises the police power in the Japanese Diet Building.
sen.cmt: The official name for Japanese Parliament is "Diet," but is it better to use "Congressional staffer" for non-Japanese readers?一原文一訳文の例外対処全角矢印を削除するため、分割しました。
sen.e: A Diet staffer who exercises the police power in the Japanese Diet Building.
Refer to 'Eishi.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処" " を ' ' とし、ピリオドの位置を変えました。
sen.e: Refer to 'Eishi.'
